page.title: 02NEWCASTLE CHURCH, BRIDGEND.
page.content: Newcastle Church stands on a limestone bluff below the remains of the Norman Castle.It overlooks the River Ogmore and the Old Stone Bridge that gave birth to the town of Bridgend. The square tower has recently been repointed and,although almost four hundred years old,is an impressive structure.Inside we admired the simple stone font,the fine timbers and beautiful windows. We were interested in the varied work of the Church.A youth group meets during the winter.Mothers and their children form another group.A fete is held annually.Â£1500.00 had been raised on the Saturday before our visit although it had rained heavily throughout the day. Since Norman times Newcastle Church has served village,town and community.
